content:
Hey folks! We started testing #19590 a few days ago. It adds a new widget to the compose box if you're composing to a view different than what you're looking at, which takes to the topic you're composing to. Any feedback so far?

Screen-Shot-2022-04-08-at-12.02.28-PM.png

I've been appreciating having the button!

I'm not happy with the "Narrow to message recipient" tooltip wording. It feels to technical and hard to parse to me.
Similarly, I'd like to reword the "Narrow to current compose box recipient" phrasing in the ? menu.
I generally wouldn't describe a topic as a "recipient".

Alya Abbott said:

I've been appreciating having the button!

I'm not happy with the "Narrow to message recipient" tooltip wording. It feels to technical and hard to parse to me.

I totally agree with this point -- I did not understand at all what does this widget do from the tooltip displayed -- I had to go to #chat.zulip.org to understand the feature it adds. :)
Maybe simply "Go to topic" would make sense in the compose box context?
Also -- Don't you think this widget should not be displayed if I'm present in the same topic in which I'm composing my message?

Like, I was a little confused when I saw this button first time -- for what does it do ?

and now after reading about it in #chat.zulip.org -- I think this widget should only be displayed when I'm present in a topic and I'm composing a message in some other topic, thoughts ?

Jai soni said:

Also -- Don't you think this widget should not be displayed if I'm present in the same topic in which I'm composing my message?

Yes, that's how it currently works. I'm realizing that it can be confusing when you're in a stream narrow, but it so happens that only the topic you're composing to is visible. Perhaps that's what you're seeing Jai soni ?

To be more clear with what I'm trying to say -->

I don't understand the need of this widget in this situation of compose box -->
image.png
I'm present in a topic localStorage.. and also I'm composing a message in the same topic, so what's the need of this widget now?
Yes, I would expect the widget not to be shown in that situation. If you're seeing it, that's a bug.

I find it really useful for when I'm in a steam narrow and starting a new topic. I see an old topic name in the autocomplete, but prior to this button finding the contents of that old topic was hard - go to the left bar, "more topics", search for the topic name, click.

Now, I can choose from the completion, click the arrow, and get context on what will appear above my new message in the topic narrow view.

Alya Abbott said:

Yes, I would expect the widget not to be shown in that situation. If you're seeing it, that's a bug.

I don't see the widget when I got to that topic and open the compose box. Jai soni could you provide a more detailed replicator?

Alex Vandiver said:

I find it really useful for when I'm in a steam narrow and starting a new topic. I see an old topic name in the autocomplete, but prior to this button finding the contents of that old topic was hard - go to the left bar, "more topics", search for the topic name, click.

Yeah, previously it required somehow learning about the CTRL-. shortcut.

Umm --
1.) Narrow to a topic, open the compose box. (you won't see the widget right now)
2.) Narrow to some other topic using mouse. (now you would start seeing this widget)

So, My concern was -- what's the need of this widget in this case also ?
The widget is useful any time you're viewing a topic that's different from the one you're composing to, which sounds like what you're describing?
https://www.icloud.com/iclouddrive/02dV7msRhWEjpJPd-U_6tr3wg#Screen_Recording_2022-04-09_at_12.58.56_AM

OK, so it might be the case I'm getting the use case of this widget wrong -- but I did not understand the use of this widget when i was present in unread pills in.. and my message also was suppose to go in the same topic.
was i able to convey my statement with the help of recording?
Ahh, I see now! So the bug is that if you change the compose box topic in an open compose box by clicking on another topic, the button incorrectly appears. @Dinesh Ch FYI
Thanks for the report and screen capture, Jai soni !

Alya Abbott said:

Maybe simply "Go to topic" would make sense in the compose box context?

"Go to topic" seems good to me. I'd prefer "go to conversation" (or maybe just have that one for PMs).
Yeah I think "go to conversation" is good for a generic phrase we can use for both topics and PMs.
Works for me.
Can we improve the ? phrasing from "Narrow to current compose box recipient" somehow? In that setting, it needs to be made clear what conversation we're referring to.

Alya Abbott said:

Ahh, I see now! So the bug is that if you change the compose box topic in an open compose box by clicking on another topic, the button incorrectly appears. Dinesh Ch FYI

Fixed it in PR #19590. Was incorrectly updating the button visibility after the narrow changes but before the compose recipient changes.
Also, changed the tooltip wording to "Go to conversation".
Are we happy with the button color in day mode? It is accidentally blue. I've changed it in the PR and posted a screenshot at #design > narrow to topic/pms when composing
I think we might as well try it without the blue here, and see what folks prefer.
